alert.note: Alert for Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 5:22PM CDT until May 04 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM CDT FOR KAY COUNTY... At 522 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northeast of Blackwell, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Tonkawa, Newkirk, Braman, Kildare, Chilocco, Hardy, Nardin, northern Kaw Lake and Peckham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
